latex:
A child has a set of $96$ distinct blocks. Each block is one of $2$ materials (\textit{plastic, wood}), $3$ sizes (\textit{small, medium, large}), $4$ colors (\textit{blue, green, red, yellow}), and $4$ shapes (\textit{circle, hexagon, square, triangle}). How many blocks in the set are different from the "\textit{plastic medium red circle}" in exactly two ways? (The "\textit{wood medium red square}" is such a block.)\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 29 \qquad\textbf{(B)}\ 39 \qquad\textbf{(C)}\ 48 \qquad\textbf{(D)}\ 56 \qquad\textbf{(E)}\ 62 $
